page.title: 05Avards Bakery, Lamberhurst
page.content: Lamberhurst is fortunate to have a working{bakery}supplying the surrounding villages. Mr and Mrs Avard's family have owned the bakery since it was built in the 17th century, although part was used as a horse and carriages for hire depot. In the night my dad has to get up at midnight to start baking. He uses six different types of flour to make white bread. He also makes wheat germ, wheat meal, hovis, granary and cakes. The oven temperature has to be between 350 and 460 degrees fahrenheit. Our shop, in the centre of{Lamberhurst,}is open between 8am and 5pm, and provides a wide variety of bread and cakes.
